unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Under Scrutiny**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Under Scrutiny

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – Recent reports indicate growing concerns over quality control measures within several manufacturing sectors, prompting calls for stricter enforcement and enhanced auditing. A particular focus is on the automotive component industry, where adherence to international standards is crucial for export competitiveness.
normalised: New Delhi, India – Recent reports indicate growing concerns over quality control measures within several manufacturing sectors, prompting calls for stricter enforcement and enhanced auditing. A particular focus is on the automotive component industry, where adherence to international standards is crucial for export competitiveness.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras is reportedly collaborating with several companies to develop AI-powered quality control systems, aiming to reduce human error and improve overall efficiency. Preliminary findings suggest a potential reduction in defective parts by up to 15% within pilot projects.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Madras is reportedly collaborating with several companies to develop A I-powered quality control systems, aiming to reduce human error and improve overall efficiency. Preliminary findings suggest a potential reduction in defective parts by up to fifteen percent within pilot projects.

unnormalised: Industry experts are referencing the manufacturing inefficiencies portrayed in the classic Bollywood film "Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year" to highlight the importance of robust quality control processes from raw material procurement to final product delivery.
normalised: Industry experts are referencing the manufacturing inefficiencies portrayed in the classic Bollywood film "Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year" to highlight the importance of robust quality control processes from raw material procurement to final product delivery.

unnormalised: Supply chain disruptions, exacerbated by recent geopolitical tensions, are also contributing to quality control challenges, with companies struggling to maintain consistency across their networks. The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) is urging the government to provide incentives for investing in advanced quality control technologies.
normalised: Supply chain disruptions, exacerbated by recent geopolitical tensions, are also contributing to quality control challenges, with companies struggling to maintain consistency across their networks. The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (F I C C I) is urging the government to provide incentives for investing in advanced quality control technologies.
